name: Hotel Omni Mont-Royal

reviews.text: Travelled to Montreal this past summer with my mom to watch the Roger's Cup Women's Tennis. Found the Omni to be adequate. Room was spacious enough, beds were small but comfortable. Chambermaids were friendly and kept room clean.Fresh new paint could make it a bit better - just a bit outdated. Pool area was decent. Wasn't aware that there was a continental breakfast until our last day - upon check-in front staff didn't say much about anything. We stayed for 5 days. Lots of attractions nearby. St. Laurent Street was also about a 20 minute walk to the traditional part of Montreal - we loved that stroll. Hotel was right near the McGill University. St. Catherine's is 2 long blocks away. Crescent Street is also about the same distance. If you walked to Old Montreal it would take you about 45 minutes (going downhill). Subway system was very handy.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

likes.liked: — No frills hotel - pretty basic was never busy, elevators always available - were on 28th floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, we paid $132/night, which I would say was reasonable for the room we had. I certainly would have been disappointed if the room charge would have been more - Eva from Regina, SK Canada
reviews.title: Excellent choice!
great location
reviews.text: My husband and I booked one night at the Omni Mont-Royal through Priceline.com. We did the "name your price" option, and for $100 we were spoiled! It exceed our expecations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was massive, king size bed, robes, great view.The lobby is beautiful, service is great and I can I say this, the entire hotel just smells really good?
reviews.title: Great View of Mt. Royal

reviews.text: The location is ideal, two blocks from St-Catherine.
reviews.title: Unsatisfying

reviews.text: This hotel has a great location and the staff are all without exception very pleasant, I had 4 warm encounters with staff before I even checked in. This hotel is priced well below other 4 star hotels for a reason, it needs serious renovations. The first room I checked into was old and had a poor view, I asked to be moved and the staff were very gracious and obliged.
reviews.title: Renovations Required

reviews.text: The T.V was an old Phillips pre-1980 model, the wooden furniture had serious chips and the drapes were in a word ancient, the pool chairs were threading apart and could give way at any moment.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, slightly run down

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights while on a work trip to Montreal. The hotel is in a fairly central location in the core of the city. The room was fairly large, but a little run down. The carpet had stains, and the walls were scuffed. The bed was comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was VERY weak. The hotel staff were polite and friendly. As business hotels go, the Omni is OK. But, you can probably find better properties at the same price point.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant and willing to accomodate

reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend in December 2010 and it was a great stay. During our first night we had an "incident" in our room (at 1am) and upon reporting it to the front desk we were moved into another room.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: The next day the manager offered to pay for our stay but because we already paid via Expedia we instead were offered a comp stay.
reviews.title: Perfect location and great value

reviews.text: Upon arrival the smallest things count, being greeted by Pierre, having my bags taken in from the taxi & the welcoming staff at reception added to the experience, the room was huge & also did deliver a high speed internet access! room was cleaned to a higher standard than my own every day, breakfast was great & it's local to everything you could want, best way to get around is by metro by far, a place i would love to come back to again for business or pleasure, such a friendly & cultured city!
reviews.title: A Must for luxury & comfort, will be coming back again!

reviews.text: I live in the outer regions of the greater Montreal area and booked several days at this hotel in part to do business, and in part as a stay-cation to relax and attend Les Francofolies (multi-day music festival with free and paid ticket performances). I was introduced to the Omni in the beginning of June because this is where McGill alumni were invited to attend breakfast with William Shatner who had just received an honorary doctorate from his alma mater, McGill. The breakfast was super and the hotel looked great -- so it I decided to check out the accommodations. I had read some of the Tripadvisor reviews online... including one that mentioned old carpets... so I was not sure what to expect.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Fitness/Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Omni was offering a super affordable rate, especially for a posh downtown hotel. The accommodations were perfectly fine. Yes.... the carpet is a bit old etc...but everything was super clean, the room was fairly large, and the bathroom was great. Even had a phone in the bathroom on the wall near the toilette. The temperature is adjustable which I appreciated, the air conditioning was great. I was not there to watch tv but will say for those who want to do a lot of that, the tv was a regular 26" type in an armoir --- the usual major US and Canadian chanels, not the fancy ones per se.
reviews.title: Reliable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was absolutely perfect for me as I had to do business at McGill which is just across the street. It was also within walking distance from the Festival Place where the concerts were held (around the area of Place des Arts). I was also able to walk to China Town, Old Montreal, the Old Port etc. There was a science exhibition at the Old Port. This was a fairly long walk, where I went to one area and spent time, then went to the next etc. It might be 30+ minutes to walk back from the Old Port. There are lovely places to lunch in China Town, Old Montreal, and a nice Bistro at the Old Port (there is a food court there too) and even a little seafood shack a bit west of the Science center... lobster rolls and chowder.
reviews.title: Crappy service even before check in

reviews.text: The service at the Omni was exceptional, especially the Concierge Service. They have a very nice pool located outside on the Third Floor of the building. There is also a small deck to the right of the pool with more lounge chairs. The fitness facilities were probably the best I have ever had in a hotel. There are a few rooms. One room has several cardio machines, free weights, benches etc. There is another room that has mats, balls, a punching bag etc. They have free towels available in the fitness area and the hotel room had robes which some people used to go down to the pool. In the fitness/pool area, there is also a nice little lounge room and a locker room with showers etc....and a whirpool, etc. There is a Spa (AmeriSpa) within the hotel where depending on what services people take, they can have access to the fitness and pool area even if not staying in a hotel room (hence the locker room etc). It was super relaxing to use the fitness center and pool. I saw some people had coffees etc delivered to the pool area, very nice, and there were attendants on duty. Something I rarely see at most hotels.
reviews.title: Could not ask for more...

reviews.text: Once again, I received the greatest of service from the staff at the Omni Mount Royal in Montreal. Starting with the reservation clerk, Jean-Michelle, to the very welcoming doorman and the extremely accommodating front desk staff, I could not have felt more welcome. The location of the hotel is perfect there is a great pool and fitness center. The hotel needs a bit of updating and the pool should be open later during the summer hours. Other than that, I have no complaints and plan to stay there whenever I am in Montreal. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Location & Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel and great client service.
reviews.title: Great stay in Montreal and will come back

reviews.text: Nice room, good size, no noises, very clean.
reviews.title: Extra charges for No Reason

reviews.text: Perfect outdoor pool to cool off during summer time!
reviews.title: A Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice location, next to the jazz festival, bike rentals and downtown.
reviews.title: Great value, location and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Omni Mont Royal for 2 nights over Canada Day holiday.
reviews.title: Omni Mont Royal - Definitely not a 5 star experience

likes.liked: — Metro stop is just around the corner
likes.disliked: — Had to wait for an hour to get into room!!

reviews.text: -We arrived at 4 PM after a long drive and were told that our room would not be ready for at least another hour. My wife and I were very tired but the front desk staff did not seem to care, so we sat in the hotel lobby for 45 mins until the room was ready. Being a Select Guest member was of no use. I found this totally unacceptable.
reviews.title: Place to Crash

likes.liked: — Big clean rooms, great A/C, location in downtown Montreal

reviews.text: - We were given a room on the backside of the hotel. The garbage trucks with their back-up alarms started and 3:30AM and went until 6:00AM. Eventhough we were on the 16th floor, the ding-ding- ding of the back-up alarms was loud and clearly audible. Needless to say, we could not get back to sleep after 3:30 AM. Perhaps a room on the Sherbrooke St. side would have been quieter.
reviews.title: Just average hotel. NO WAY 5 stars!

reviews.text: The room itself was very nice. Bed was ok. The loveseat was quite comfortable for reading . Although the furnishings were a bit dated, everything was very clean. Bathroom was nice and spacious with good amenities. There was even a bidet. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant. as there were some local places that we wanted to try.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: It was definitely not a 5 or even 4 star experience. I would call it a 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: loved the location!

likes.disliked: — lobby bar not very appealing spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We planned to be in Montreal starting 8-30, then leave for Quebec City 9-3, then come back to a final night in Montreal 9-5 before our early flight home 9-6. We had originally booked at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth but switched to Omni due to the strike at the Fairmont. For a much lower price we got a great, large room with a view. As Omni Select members there is no charge for in room internet and a morning beverage is complimentary. Very clean, nice rooms, good service. We thought for the final night in Montreal before the flight home we would keep the reservation at the Fairmont. The strike was still in full force. The non striking hotel workers were doing their very best, but I wouldn't stay there for more than one night while the strike was continuing. We've stayed at Omni properties in New Orleans and Orlando and had positive experiences each time.
reviews.title: Glad We Switched

likes.liked: — Value for price, location and condition of rooms

reviews.text: I was there between the end of Aug and beginning of Sept. I booked a room for a few days and didn't have any problems with the service. The room was cleaned well and was able to sleep with no noise until I left in the mornings around 9:30. I don't know about the pool etc.. I didn't use them. Staff were friendly too.
reviews.title: Stayed for a few days.

reviews.text: I had a wonderful room, with a comfortable bed and very clean bathroom. I was exceptionally pleased with the space I had. The staff were friendly and helpful and the food was good. The facilities were excellent.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great rooms

reviews.text: The location is very good too and just a short walk from the main areas of Montreal for shopping, eating, getting coach tours etc. McGill University is nearby and has a lovely campus to visit.
reviews.title: Outstanding location and service at the Omni.

reviews.text: My family recently had a pleasant stay at the Omni Mont Royal and I was extremely impressed by the high level of service we received from the concierge, front desk and valet.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Omni

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently tried the Priceline.com name your price for a hotel feature, i picked the highest standard available 4 star and went with the recommended 120 a night bid, not including tax. "Congratulations, your bid has been accepted at the Omni Mont-Royal".
reviews.title: Ive never been so disappointed!!

reviews.text: Now I have done my fair share of traveling and have stayed in about 20 or so 4 star hotels in the last year.
reviews.title: Great location for a weekend trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE OMNI MONT-ROYAL is by no means any where close to a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: Great value - convenient location

reviews.text: The Room:
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great service, nice sized rooms and we will be back!

reviews.text: -The rooms smell musty, and have an old cigar stench, and it wasn't just my room as they showed me 2 others and were all equally gross.
reviews.title: Great location, large rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a beautiful hotel, with clean spacious rooms. Located in the Museum district, this hotel is very close to the famous Rue St. Catherine - lots of shopping, and food! The hotel staff are very courteous and friendly. We asked for extra towels as we used ours for the swimming pool, and they came to our room within minutes! Parking is $18/day underground across the street, or $24 or so at the hotel, internet use is $5 per half hour. There is a swimming pool, a sauna, and a hot tub (that they clean every Sunday night about an hour before closing, but unfortunately they didn't tell us that, so just when we needed to relax in the hot tub, it was closed :( There is an exercise facility that is open 24/7, and they even have classes that are taught by an instructor! What's great is that they have a mini bar that you can restock, as there are no 'seals' or tape on the beverages - it's a plus if you really need something, and you don't have to feel guilty about paying $10 for a bottle of beer! (We didn't do this, but you could!).
reviews.title: 3 nights of bliss...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a lovely place, and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Always Perrfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My expectations were met yet again. The hotel is exceptional. I guess the other reviewers had different rooms. We stayed here from June 29-july 3. My room was a delux, not a junior suit as before. A huge king size bed, big bathroom with thick, plush towels, and all the usual amenities. The location is excellent for downtown shopping and mont royal walking. the rice was higher than the other hotel I would stay at 3 days later but it was worth every penny. I was given a 20% off coupon for the Spa. The wait at check in and out was too long . But the accomodations was priceless. Our room overlooked sherbrooke street. We had turndown service with chocolates on our pillows.
reviews.title: Over priced for what it is...

likes.disliked: — The fire drill that went off in our room for 20 minutes while we were jetlagged

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, this hotel spoiles you and will be my first choice for any stay in Montreal. Check out La Belle province for Breakfast and the peel pub. Both on peel street. Your taste buds will not be dissappointed.
reviews.title: Omni had great service

likes.disliked: — the outdated rooms and the pool

reviews.text: I will be back next Canada Day celebration.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Omni!

likes.liked: — Spacious, comfortable rooms with great beds, great location, good for business and leisure
likes.disliked: — I can't even think of anything to complain about, but my daughter would have liked more TV channels

description: A timeless emblem of the Montreal tourist landscape, the Hotel Omni Mont-Royal strives to give guests an unforgettable experience infused with an authentic flair, a modern ethos, and a blend of warmth, comfort and elegance. The newly transformed 299 guest rooms and suites are true retreats of serenity and relaxation with a residential feel. Elegant and graceful, the décor serves as a comfortable backdrop for both work and leisure. Known for its unparalleled customer service, the Hotel Omni Mont-Royal is rated four-star by Hébergement Québec and four-diamond by AAA/CAA. The Hotel offers a full service health club and an urban pool (seasonal Mid-May to Mid-October), sauna and whirl pool. Updated amenities at the hotel provide everything required for an enjoyable stay: Alice Bar, Le Petit Opus Café, and many versatile meeting rooms. Hotel Omni Mont-Royal lets its guests immerse themselves in the urban vibe of Montreal and nestle into the "feels like home" comfort of its newly renovated guestrooms.
